alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 2:19PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Duchesne River near Randlett affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river and stream flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Duchesne River near Randlett. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, minor flooding is expected across low-lying agricultural land along the Duchesne River. At 13.3 feet, fields become inundated along the river, southeast of Randlett. Some private bridges and irrigation works may also experience damage from high water and/or debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM MDT Friday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around 12.5 feet over the next several days. - Action stage is 11.6 feet. - Flood stage is 13.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
